melee.name: Melee
melee.description: This creature excels at close combat and has limited or no ranged combat capabilities.

ranged.name: Ranged
ranged.description: This creature attacks from afar and has limited or no melee combat capabilities.

ambusher.name: ambusher
ambusher.description: This creature ideally starts combat from a hidden position and waits for the optimal moment to attack.

airborne.name: airborne
airborne.description: This creature has a flying speed and can continuously stay at a distance.

charge.name: Charge
charge.description: This creature seeks close combat from the get-go and will continue to do so.

predator.name: Predator
predator.description: This creature stalks its prey and will withdraw from combat to attack again later.

pack.name: Pack
pack.description: This creature is best utilized as part of a larger group of similar creatures.

regeneration.name: Regeneration
regeneration.description: This creature has abilities allowing it to regenerate hit points during combat.

mobile.name: Mobile
mobile.description: This creature boasts superior speed and mobility, allowing it to quickly reposition itself or give chase to enemies.

tactical.name: Tactical
tactical.description: This creature’s abilities facilitate powerful synergies, increasing its effectiveness.

shock.name: Shock
shock.description: This creature is most effective during the first turns of combat.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
spellcasting.description: This creature is capable of casting spells.

demanding.name: Demanding
demanding.description: Fighting this monster requires lots of saving throws.

simple.name: Simple
simple.description: This creature excels at close combat and has limited or no ranged combat capabilities.

lethal.name: Lethal
lethal.description: This creature is more than capable of actually killing a player character.

aoe.name: AoE
aoe.description: This creature heavily utilizes >Area Of Effect< damage.

interactive.name: Interactive
interactive.description: This creature utilizes a combination of abilities, actions, bonus actions and reactions.

boss.name: Boss
boss.description: This creature boasts impressive stats and abilities, requiring several turns of intense combat that acts as a dramatic climax.

bodyguard.name: Bodyguard
bodyguard.description: This creature aims to protect another creature, rarely leaving its side and acting in the interest of keeping danger from it.

debuff.name: Debuff
debuff.description: This creature weakens or hinders its enemies.

support.name: Support
support.description: This creature strengthens its allies, increasing their effectiveness, but poses less of a challenge on its own.

tank.name: Tank
tank.description: This creature is extremely resilient, boasting a combination of a high hit point count, resistances or immunities.

minion.name: Minion
minion.description: This creature is relatively harmless on its own and is best used as a meat shield.

damage.name: Damage
damage.description: This creature is best utilized as a reliable source of damage.

mount.name: Mount
mount.description: This creature can serve as a mount.

ally.name: Ally
ally.description: This creature can act as an ally to a group of players.

pressure.name: Pressure
pressure.description: This creature provides unique challenges able to overwhelm its enemies.

hunter.name: Hunter
hunter.description: This creature concentrates its attention on single targets.

leader.name: Leader
leader.description: This creature is best utilized as the leader of a group of enemies, acting as a lynchpin for the encounter.

duelist.name: Duelist
duelist.description: This creature's set of abilites allows for an exciting back and forth with a single opponent.

gimmick.name: Gimmick
gimmick.description: This creature possesses one or more gimmicks that an encounter with this creature will revolve around.

001_vampire_beast.description: Sometimes Vampires impart the dubious gift of spawndom upon the wrong soul, stirring primordial horrors from their sleep. These vampire spawns regress to a primal state, detached from the rules that even compel their creators, driven only by their lust for terror and agony.  Primal Spawns are beyond their unwilling creators' control and they in turn feel disdain for their more â€˜evolvedâ€™ kin. Despite not having a weakness to sunlight, they prefer the shadows, as the darkness supports their preferred hunting style. And if the right opportunity arises, a Primal Vampire Spawn will not hesitate to hunt during broad daylight to indulge in the screams of horrified onlookers.
001_vampire_beast.name: Primal Vampire Spawn

002_glutony.description: This creature is the embodiment of self indulgence, the nature-given love and need for sustenance perverted and twisted into a bloated creature of repulsive proportions. Gluttony poisons mind and body in equal measure and hungers endlessly, existing for the singular purpose to make everything in existence one with itself.
002_glutony.name: Gluttony

003_female_knight_1.description: Inquisitorial Penitents are former witches, persecuted and excruciatingly converted by those they now serve as living weapons. Their connection to the arcane has been perverted, the flow of magic reversed, as they now syphon arcane energies from others with their mere presence. They stalk the lands in packs, travel as independent operatives or are part of an inquisitorial retinue, acting as both bodyguards and executioners. The most dangerous penitents, however, are those who underwent the purifications voluntarily, eager to shed the taint of witchcraft. They are the most unforgiving and zealous of their kind, hunting their tainted kin without mercy or remorse.
003_female_knight_1.name: Inquisitorial Penitent 1

004_undead_centipede.description: Curseweavers are sinister creatures exhibiting a perverse interest in the political dealings of mortal beings. This morbid curiosity draws them from their natural homes within the seven hells and causes them to establish lairs at the heart of sprawling cities or similiar centers of power and influence. Through networks of both mortal and infernal spies and agents they seek out those in pursuit of dominion over others and offer their cursework in exchange for souls and chess pieces on the political board. Curseweavers enjoy pitting their numerous minions against each other, slowly ascending as the true éminence grise behind the curtain. Civil wars, revolts or revolutions follow in the wake of a Curseweaver, the fiend oftentimes playing both sides for nourishment and sadistic pleasure in equal measure.
004_undead_centipede.name: The Curseweaver

005_assassin_1.description: If one seeks to end a life, one does not necessarily have to get their hands dirty. There are professionals trained in the art of killing, who are eager to be of service - either to earn some coin, further a dark agenda or for personal pleasure. The play of murder has thousands of scripts and props, but a knife in the dark remains an all time classic.
005_assassin_1.name: Assassin 1

006_shield_guardian_1.description: Exposure to extreme instances of magnetism might cause an as of yet unexplained transformation within Shield Guardians.The docile automatons undergo a rapid evolution, triggering both a physical transformation and a severe change in behaviour. A Polarized Shield Guardian is no longer bound to its master, resisting any attempt of external control with violent means. Their physique adapts to support a construct now geared towards offensive conflict resolution, rather than silent endurance. These creatures are exceedingly rare and, if able to break their shackles for good, wander the lands guided by their mysterious connection to both magical and magnetic forces.
006_shield_guardian_1.name: Polarized Shield Guardian Skin 1

006_shield_guardian_2.description: Exposure to extreme instances of magnetism might cause an as of yet unexplained transformation within Shield Guardians.The docile automatons undergo a rapid evolution, triggering both a physical transformation and a severe change in behaviour. A Polarized Shield Guardian is no longer bound to its master, resisting any attempt of external control with violent means. Their physique adapts to support a construct now geared towards offensive conflict resolution, rather than silent endurance. These creatures are exceedingly rare and, if able to break their shackles for good, wander the lands guided by their mysterious connection to both magical and magnetic forces.
006_shield_guardian_2.name: Polarized Shield Guardian Skin 2

007_umber_spinner.description: Umber Hulks spend their youthful days terrorising the Underdark or similar subterranean spaces. In this harsh environment, few survive long enough to see their powerful frame diminish with age, shedding the recognizable heavy chitinous plating and finally sprouting wings and a wicked stinger. On buzzing wings the now pubescent Umber Spinners set out, seeking weakened or isolated humanoids in their mission to preserve the dominion of their kind...
007_umber_spinner.name: Umber Spinner

008_aspect_of_gluttony.description: Dull-looking, dimwitted and bloated creatures, filled to the brim with noxious gas and disgusting thoughts. They nest within the fleshy crevasses of Gluttony's lumpy body and swarm out on its command, eager to gather offerings to gain their master's favour.
008_aspect_of_gluttony.name: Aspect of Gluttony

009_skeleton_henchman_1.description: If you are interested in exercising cross-regional influence and could not care less about your image,  Skeleton Henchmen are the ideal lynchpin for your entourage. They are loyal, cheap and, if you know your way around the local cemetery, rather easy to aquire. The basic Skeleton Henchman is a great foundation to expand upon, as they are highly customizable and require minimal upkeep and maintenance. Guard duty, law enforcement or warfare, Skeleton Henchmen provide satisfactory service in diverse work environments.
009_skeleton_henchman_1.name: Skeleton Henchman Skin 1

010_horse_1.description: Horses are half a ton worth of muscle crammed into an elegant and timeless frame. They are fast, they are not particularly intelligent and they are an essential component of the fantasy genre. In the context of adventuring, Horses are mainly used for travel and battle, although they may as well become trusted and loved companions to the players. This reimagination of the classic Horse embodies a sturdy and valiant creature able to support it's party on arduous voyages as well as dire combat scenarios.
010_horse_1.name: Horse Skin 1

011_trained_fighter.description: War veterans, gang members with military experience or nobles who spent a fair share of their youth under the watchful eyes of combat instructors - the Trained Fighter represents all of them and more. They are trained in the art of melee, have seen various combat scenarios and lived to tell the tale. While a rabble of peasants or a gang of highwaymen can be disposed of rather quickly and with little effort, an organized troop of Trained Fighters makes for a varitable fighting force, leading to a complex and tactical encounter for a low or even mid-level party.
011_trained_fighter.name: Trained Fighter

012_cipactli.description: Cipactli are the alleged offspring of a reptilian river god feared for his boundless rage. They roam mangrove forests and tropical river banks in packs, behaving very territorial and highly aggressive towards any kind of encroachment. Their social behaviour is suprisingly complex, with them displaying their martial skills through ritualized combat among each other. However, if isolated from its pack, a Cipactli can form an equally strong bond with any creature able to gain the Cipactli's respect by demonstrating superior prowess. Indigenous tribes have been observed utilizing bonded Cipactli as status symbols, as well as beasts of burden or instruments of war. Tribal legends tell of champions riding into battle mounted on a rampaging Cipactli, battering aside enemies and jungle trees alike in a display of rage worthy of their eponymous genitor.
012_cipactli.name: Cipactli

013_harpyia.description: Not many a  creature is as unjustly feared and detested as the Harpyia. Decried as carriers of bad omen, death and evil magic, they have been hunted to near extinction. The remaining Harpyies prefer to nest on storm-wreathed cliffsides and within coastal ravines, seeking safety in isolation. Legend has them born from wind and water, which might explain their affinity to the sea. Colonies, or *parliaments*, of Harpyies can be often found nesting atop the salt-encrusted masts and rigging of beached shipwrecks. This behaviour unfortunately further feeds the hate and fear towards them, as they stand accused of gloating over the misfortune of others, when in reality Harpyies are inclined to protect shipwrecked sailors from actual malicious creatures like the alluring Sirens.
013_harpyia.name: Harpyia

014_dragon.description: The Dragon might be the ultimate mythical creature. Almost every human culture has a being with the shared traits of a snake-like body, mighty wings, supernatural cunning and indomitable might. In some myths and folktales they are benevolent and wise, in most they are cruel and despotic. Our Dragon makes no attempt at being an ambivalent creature, skirting the border of good and evil or trying to paint the picture of a complex and often misunderstood creature. This Dragon is a scaled tyrant, a megalomaniacal lizard corrupted by the arcane energies flowing through its veins. It is avaricious, gluttonous, wrathful and treacherous - the worst traits humanity can offer, but enabled by inhabiting a body of a living and breathing natural disaster.
014_dragon.name: Dragon

015_werewolf_1.description: The Wulfen Curse is an affliction of the soul. Some humanoids already carry the seed of beasthood with them, nurturing a dark hunger for violence and bloodshed. If they give in to this hunger, the dread curse takes hold, shaping the body in accordance to the soul. Over time the Wulfen comes to detest its humanoid body, the metaphysical affliction of the soul mirrored in the physical realm. They are, however, forever trapped between worlds, for they are neither wolf nor man, but a chimeric soul burdened with an appetite for both the chase and the catch.
015_werewolf_1.name: Werewolf Skin 1

015_werewolf_2.description: The Wulfen Curse is an affliction of the soul. Some humanoids already carry the seed of beasthood with them, nurturing a dark hunger for violence and bloodshed. If they give in to this hunger, the dread curse takes hold, shaping the body in accordance to the soul. Over time the Wulfen comes to detest its humanoid body, the metaphysical affliction of the soul mirrored in the physical realm. They are, however, forever trapped between worlds, for they are neither wolf nor man, but a chimeric soul burdened with an appetite for both the chase and the catch.
015_werewolf_2.name: Werewolf Skin 2

015_werewolf_3.description: The Wulfen Curse is an affliction of the soul. Some humanoids already carry the seed of beasthood with them, nurturing a dark hunger for violence and bloodshed. If they give in to this hunger, the dread curse takes hold, shaping the body in accordance to the soul. Over time the Wulfen comes to detest its humanoid body, the metaphysical affliction of the soul mirrored in the physical realm. They are, however, forever trapped between worlds, for they are neither wolf nor man, but a chimeric soul burdened with an appetite for both the chase and the catch.
015_werewolf_3.name: Werewolf Skin 3

016_wolf_1.description: Those afflicted by the Curse of the Wulfen slowly lose themselves to the bestial urges festering within their soul. After each hunt it gets harder to take on human form and even the horrid shape of the man-wolf becomes difficult to maintain. Soon the Wolfkin have all but forgotten what it means to be human and gather around a strong Wulfen to lead them on their eternal hunt. Or just a normal Wolf.
016_wolf_1.name: Wolf 1

016_wolf_2.description: Those afflicted by the Curse of the Wulfen slowly lose themselves to the bestial urges festering within their soul. After each hunt it gets harder to take on human form and even the horrid shape of the man-wolf becomes difficult to maintain. Soon the Wolfkin have all but forgotten what it means to be human and gather around a strong Wulfen to lead them on their eternal hunt. Or just a normal Wolf.
016_wolf_2.name: Wolf 2

016_wolf_3.description: Those afflicted by the Curse of the Wulfen slowly lose themselves to the bestial urges festering within their soul. After each hunt it gets harder to take on human form and even the horrid shape of the man-wolf becomes difficult to maintain. Soon the Wolfkin have all but forgotten what it means to be human and fully dedicate themselves to the hunt. Bigger, stronger and blessed with remaining spark of malicious intellect, Wolfkin soon find themselves in charge of a pack of regular wolves, often answering the call of other hunting Wulfen, eager to redden their snout in the ensuing bloodbath. Or just a normal Wolf.
016_wolf_3.name: Wolfkin

017_dwarven_king.description: Dwarven Kings do not rule by birthright alone, but command respect earned by dilligence, grit and merit. Dwarves are a proud and stubborn folk and while they appreciate the rigid structures of monarchy, they need a reason for why a specific individual should hold the power to rule the grand cave cities, vast mountain halls and stalwart hill fortresses of dwarvenkind. However, if an aspirant to the throne manages to endure the ordeals and rites necessary to claim the title of king, their subjects serve them with unwavering loyalty. Each Dwarven King is a statesman, general and master craftsman with a body of granite, a soul of iron and a heart of gold.
017_dwarven_king.name: Dwarven King

018_giant_spider_1.description: Based on your disposition towards spiders in general, a confrontation with Megaarachnids can range from unpleasant to traumatising. They are vicious predators who are dangerous when you see them, as they can unexpectedly cross surprising distances with mighty leaps, but infinitively more dangerous if you don't, as they excel at lurking in the shadows while waiting in their web, eager to strike as their prey becomes more and more entangled. Megaarachnids usually hunt alone or in small packs to take down bigger prey, but are also known to band together in vast colonies, occupying claustrophobic burrows or abandoned structures, creating a web-covered and egg-filled nightmare realm littered with the dried out husks of their victims.
018_giant_spider_1.name: Spider Skin 1

018_giant_spider_8.description: Based on your disposition towards spiders in general, a confrontation with Megaarachnids can range from unpleasant to traumatising. They are vicious predators who are dangerous when you see them, as they can unexpectedly cross surprising distances with mighty leaps, but infinitively more dangerous if you don't, as they excel at lurking in the shadows while waiting in their web, eager to strike as their prey becomes more and more entangled. Megaarachnids usually hunt alone or in small packs to take down bigger prey, but are also known to band together in vast colonies, occupying claustrophobic burrows or abandoned structures, creating a web-covered and egg-filled nightmare realm littered with the dried out husks of their victims.
018_giant_spider_8.name: Spider Skin 8

019_reef_keeper.description: Reef Keepers manifest around hydrothermal vents and venture the sea bed in search of untouched subnautic ecosystems like lush coral reefs or kelp forests, where they guard the native lifeforms against invasive species or destructive unnatural forces. Their true form is hard to discern, as they are overgrown with a thick crust of mineral-rich sediment. This crust acts both as natural armor, as well as a rich source of nutrients for nearby flora and fauna. Reef Keepers are usually docile, but if they consider their chosen protectorate endangered they make use of a vast arsenal of exotic defensive capabilities
019_reef_keeper.name: Reef Keeper

020_grimgheist.description: Grimgheists are soul-constructs fashioned from murderous and vengeful souls by particularly ruthless practicers of dark and forbidden arts. Driven by an innate thirst for murder and furtherly incited by their creators, the Grimgheist are tasked to either haunt a specific target or to just wreak havoc among the enemies of its master. As they can effortlessly travel between the profane and the ethereal world, they make for efficient assassins, being able to materialize infront of their hapless target and unleash horrible acts of violence upon it, fueled by pure hatred for the living.
020_grimgheist.name: Grimgheist

021_ghoul_wretchling.description: The scratching and scrawling noises of Ghoul Wretchlings in the walls and under the floor boards herald an incoming Ghoul Invasion. In the following nights people disappear from the streets or the safety of their homes, overwhelmed and paralyzed by  swarms of the scrawny Ghoul Wretchlings, before being dragged to the underground lairs as nourishment for the advancing main force of ghoulish invaders.
021_ghoul_wretchling.name: Ghoul Wretchling

022_orc_shaman.description: Shamans are the spiritual leaders of an orc warhost. They maintain the moral of the troops by conducting bonding rituals and are generally tasked with a wide array of ceremonial duties. Even though they are feared and respected, Shamans often are outsiders, as their reclusive nature and connection to the spiritual world warps them into capricious eccentrics. Most Shamans are not bound to any host, as their true loyalty lies with the shamanistic covens they belong to, often only supporting a host chief when their reign of terror furthers the Shamans own, often concealed, agenda. In combat, Shamans are fearsome opponents who may call upon forces of nature to bring their enemies to their knees. They are able to call upon aid from beyond the grave and inspire the troops surrounding them to fight even harder, as they feel their ancestor's gaze upon them.
022_orc_shaman.name: Orc Shaman

023_orc_warchief.description: The Warchief is the single greatest authority within the ranks of a war host - an inspiring, or at least intimidating, leader, a successful commander and a powerful warrior. If they set foot onto a battlefield, their troops throw themselves every more recklessly at the enemy ranks, seeking the approval of their sovereign. Every trace of weakness must purged and every defeat could spell doom for an aspiring conqueror. This realisation often leaves War Chiefs paranoid and choleric, while their constant need to prove their might and tactical acumen drives them to ever greater bloodshed and destruction.
023_orc_warchief.name: Orc Warchief

024_kentauros.description: Where the azure sky and the lush green of viridian grasslands meet, the Kentauroi reign without equal. They are the undisputed lords of vast plains, steppes, taigas or savannahs. Being nomadic and reclusive, most live in tribal herd-clans, eternally roaming the sacred lands of their forebearers. But there are tales from the eastern fringes, describing hordes of Kentauroi coming together under the banners of a Great Khan, blocking out the skies with thousands of arrows and grinding villages, armies and fortress gates into the dust below their hooves.
024_kentauros.name: Kentauros

025_trained_archer_1.description: Ranger, hunters or city guards standing watch on battlements or rooftops - the Trained Archer is a stand-in for every man and woman well versed in the art of the bow. They are capable sharpshooters and can be relied upon in the heat of battle, an ambush or even an assassination. With the weaker members of a party threatened with a barrage of arrows, an organized unit of Trained Archers makes for a flexible and deadly force, leading to a complex and tactical encounter for a low or even mid-level party.
025_trained_archer_1.name: Trained Archer Skin 1

025_trained_archer_2.description: Ranger, hunters or city guards standing watch on battlements or rooftops - the Trained Archer is a stand-in for every man and woman well versed in the art of the bow. They are capable sharpshooters and can be relied upon in the heat of battle, an ambush or even an assassination. With the weaker members of a party threatened with a barrage of arrows, an organized unit of Trained Archers makes for a flexible and deadly force, leading to a complex and tactical encounter for a low or even mid-level party.
025_trained_archer_2.name: Trained Archer Skin 2

025_trained_archer_3.description: Ranger, hunters or city guards standing watch on battlements or rooftops - the Trained Archer is a stand-in for every man and woman well versed in the art of the bow. They are capable sharpshooters and can be relied upon in the heat of battle, an ambush or even an assassination. With the weaker members of a party threatened with a barrage of arrows, an organized unit of Trained Archers makes for a flexible and deadly force, leading to a complex and tactical encounter for a low or even mid-level party.
025_trained_archer_3.name: Trained Archer Skin 3

040_ossian_debt_collector.description: The Debt Collectors are operatives of the Ossian Bank, tasked with tracking and retrieving especially elusive debtors. Despite their harrowing appearance, Ossian Debt Collectors are courteous and sophisticated negotiators, blessed with the endless patience of the undead and prodigious language skills. When approaching a debtor, they initially aim on settling things amicably, politely asking the transient debtor to accompany them to the Ossian Bank to stand before the Tribunal. When met with unreasonableness or hostility, the Debt Collectors begrudgingly change tactics in favour of more direct means of apprehension. It is unclear if their skeletal appearance reflects a Collector's true being or if it only appears as such to their targets, combining two of the things mortals fear most: death and tax collectors.
040_ossian_debt_collector.name: Ossian Debt Collector

041_elephant.description: Elephants are intelligent, social and awe-inspiring creatures inhabiting savannahs, jungles and deserts of countless realms. Many cultures consider them sacred, recognizing the gentle soul of a towering, but kind creature through their caring eyes. Elephants can coexist with many different folks, acting as support for the workforce or as devastating living siege weapons in warfare. Killing wild elephants however may draw the ire of its relatives and enraged elephants are able to tear down a settlement brick by brick, if so inclined.
041_elephant.name: Elephant

042_mournbride.description: Mournbrides are the tortured souls of women dying a violent death on what was promised to be the happiest day of their lifes: their wedding day. Great tragedy usually surrounds a Mournbride's ermergence, like murder at the hands of a jealous rival or the taking of ones own life after being left at the altar. Still wrapped in the tattered and blood splattered remains of their wedding gowns, Mournbrides haunt places of great significance to the departed individual, like their family home, wedding venue or secret a meeting place with their former beloved. If their would-be spouse is still alive, the Mournbride will jealously watch over them, often causing more harm than good in their twisted need to protect them.
042_mournbride.name: Mournbride

043_mind_golem.description: Mind Golems are enforcer-creatures crafted by Wizard councils, a mighty body shaped from synthetic flesh imbued with a powerful vat-grown brain, designed to contain the councils Mindmeld. A Mindmeld is psychic amalgamation of the wizards intellect and arcane potential, directly channeling their might and will into their creation, allowing it to act more independently than other forms of Golems. Their fused psyches birth new independent thought slaved to their will, which makes Mind Golems highly intelligent and capable of stratetic planning and tactical acumen. This, paired with their enourmous strength and innate magic abilities, makes for a truly dangerous living weapon, capable of completing the most daring operations for their masters.
043_mind_golem.name: Mind Golem

044_amygdalyan.description: Amygdalyan are predators from beyond the thin veil separating reality from the infinite ocean of madness beyond. They are drawn to trauma and tragedy like moths to a flame, first appearing in the dreams of their chosen victim, before infiltrating their mind, driving their hosts to bouts of insanity and paranoia before destroying their psyche and moving on, their perverse hunger seated for the time being. If cornered, an Amygdalyan is a cunning and perfidioius foe, using it enemies' greatest fears against them and until they perish from the strain the constant terror puts on their body and mind.
044_amygdalyan.name: Amygdalyan

045_shattermaw.description: Shattermaws are colossal bad-tempered monstrosities clad in nearly impenetrable osteodermic armour, consisting of bone knobs, plates and spine-like outgrows. Despite their turtle-like appearance, they appear to be an evolutionary offshoot of semi-aquatic sharks. Their thick leathery skin mirrors the swamp-green of their habitat and their cragged shells and bone protrusions become eventually overgrown by moss, algae and lichens, making Shattermaws surprisingly difficult to notice. Their diet consists of everything unlucky enough to wander in front of its eponymous maw, supplemented by anything barely resembling actual prey - including mossy logs, mid-sized boulders or small vehicles. This leads to swamps and river banks within Shattermaw territory being lined with the wreckage of skiffs or rafts displaying their signature corrosive bite marks.
045_shattermaw.name: Shattermaw

046_garghoul.description: A variant form of the common Ghoul, its tattered wings making it capable of flight. After nightfall, Garghouls stalk the skies. They are to locate worthwile prey, alerting their swarm upon discovery. As one, the Garghouls descend, paralyzing their victims with their bite before carrying them off into the dark. If acting as part of a larger force of Ghouls under the command of a higher Ghoul unlifeform, Garghouls often form the second wave of a larger invasion, using their maddening screams to disorient their terrified victims, before the main force emerges from their hidden dwellings. Swarms of Garghouls also patrol the vast caverns of the subterran Ghoul realms, seeking out intruders and calling their pale brethren to join them in their feast.
046_garghoul.name: Garghoul

047_swifttalon_raptor.description: Lightning fast, agile and deadly - Swifttalon Raptors showcase peak evolutionary efficiency. They hunt in small packs, stalking and outmaneuvering prey much larger than themselves. When the Raptors have their prey encircled, they first attack in waves, probing their quarry's defenses and opening up gashing wounds with their crooked talons. Lastly they overwhelm with numbers, bearing down on their exhausted prey in a flood of scales, teeth and claws.
047_swifttalon_raptor.name: Swifttalon raptor

048_stormwyvern.description: An especially powerful Blue Dragon can infuse a wyvern with its arcane draconic energy, elevating it to a Stormwyvern. Stormwyverns are bestowed a semblance of their master's elemental affinity and cunning. They serve in the dragon's forces as heralds and subcommanders, their increased intelligence allowing for a rudimentary grasp on the draconic language and a crude understanding of battle tactics.
048_stormwyvern.name: Stormwyvern

049_poisonfang.description: Poison Fangs are the elite assassins of the various serpent cults infesting overgrown temple cities or infiltrating colonial societies. Promising candidates are singled out from their brood mates early on, undergoing harrowing psycho-indoctrination to increase their resistances to various poisons and toxins, hone their inherent hypnotic abilities and trigger the transformation into a even more snake-like being. Due to their unique talents they become excellent operatives, making Poison Fangs ideal tools for political assassinations, terror campaigns or insidious purges within the own ranks.
049_poisonfang.name: Poisonfang

050_amber_idol.description: Amber Idols are constructs crafted from anointed amber, fossilized resin obtained from sacred trees. While humanoid in stature and gait, their heads resemble bestial guardian spirits of old. Amber Idols are tasked with guarding hidden temples and lost sites that harbour great evil, tirelessly patrolling ancient gaols to ensure the continued confinement of the horrors sealed within.
050_amber_idol.name: Amber Idol

051_toxic_gobbler.description: Toxic as a Gobbler is a common idiom and yet it understates the danger posed by a Gobbler. Their garishly coloured, lumpy and spongy skin hides toxin glands which release a quickly evaporating colour- and odorless toxin that, upon skin contact or inhalation, leads to harrowing pain, long lasting paralysis and even death. Due to this feature, Gobblers have almost no natural predators, causing them to generally act carefree, curious and playful. This  makes them even more dangerous, as Gobblers fearlessly seek out the company of other beings to play with them - oftentimes accidently killing them in the process.  Some assume the toxicity to be a result of the Gobbler's diet, raising the question on what on earth Gobblers are eating.
051_toxic_gobbler.name: Toxic Gobler

052_wendigo_1.description: Wendigos plague humanoid civilization since the dawn of time. Nothing embodies the cruelty and danger of untamed wilderness as well as the Wendigo. They are the terror of the wilderness incarnate, primal fear given a gangly shape and raking claws. Their true origin remains unknown, but some cultures perceive them to be spirits of hunger and greed, possessing avaricious individuals and turning them into the ferocious predators that stalk dark woods and bleak frontiers, hunting and devouring their former kin. Wendigos are swift and silent hunters, terrifying stalkers and savage butchers, capable of outmaneuvering and outsmarting even well-armed and steadfast groups of adventurers before unleashing upon them a terrifying display of primal carnage, leaving red snow in their wake, as they adorn their hunting grounds with grisly trophies.
052_wendigo_1.name: Wendigo Skin 1

052_wendigo_2.description: Wendigos plague humanoid civilization since the dawn of time. Nothing embodies the cruelty and danger of untamed wilderness as well as the Wendigo. They are the terror of the wilderness incarnate, primal fear given a gangly shape and raking claws. Their true origin remains unknown, but some cultures perceive them to be spirits of hunger and greed, possessing avaricious individuals and turning them into the ferocious predators that stalk dark woods and bleak frontiers, hunting and devouring their former kin. Wendigos are swift and silent hunters, terrifying stalkers and savage butchers, capable of outmaneuvering and outsmarting even well-armed and steadfast groups of adventurers before unleashing upon them a terrifying display of primal carnage, leaving red snow in their wake, as they adorn their hunting grounds with grisly trophies.
052_wendigo_2.name: Wendigo Skin 2

052_wendigo_3.description: Wendigos plague humanoid civilization since the dawn of time. Nothing embodies the cruelty and danger of untamed wilderness as well as the Wendigo. They are the terror of the wilderness incarnate, primal fear given a gangly shape and raking claws. Their true origin remains unknown, but some cultures perceive them to be spirits of hunger and greed, possessing avaricious individuals and turning them into the ferocious predators that stalk dark woods and bleak frontiers, hunting and devouring their former kin. Wendigos are swift and silent hunters, terrifying stalkers and savage butchers, capable of outmaneuvering and outsmarting even well-armed and steadfast groups of adventurers before unleashing upon them a terrifying display of primal carnage, leaving red snow in their wake, as they adorn their hunting grounds with grisly trophies.
052_wendigo_3.name: Wendigo Skin 3

052_wendigo_4.description: Wendigos plague humanoid civilization since the dawn of time. Nothing embodies the cruelty and danger of untamed wilderness as well as the Wendigo. They are the terror of the wilderness incarnate, primal fear given a gangly shape and raking claws. Their true origin remains unknown, but some cultures perceive them to be spirits of hunger and greed, possessing avaricious individuals and turning them into the ferocious predators that stalk dark woods and bleak frontiers, hunting and devouring their former kin. Wendigos are swift and silent hunters, terrifying stalkers and savage butchers, capable of outmaneuvering and outsmarting even well-armed and steadfast groups of adventurers before unleashing upon them a terrifying display of primal carnage, leaving red snow in their wake, as they adorn their hunting grounds with grisly trophies.
052_wendigo_4.name: Wendigo Skin 4

053_magmatic_coreborn.description: Coreborn rise from fissures or smoldering calderas as a result of increased volcanic activity. Combining aspects of both fire and earth elementals, they differ from their kin due to their amiable disposition towards humanoids. A Magmatic Coreborn may choose to protect a village built on the slope of a volcano or at the heart of a high island, using its dominance over earth and fire to ward off both natural and unnatural disaster from their chosen people. Many Coreborn are worshipped as minor deities by their tribes, growing in power through veneration.
053_magmatic_coreborn.name: Magmatic Coreborn

054_bog_strider.description: Bog Striders are large predatory insects towering on spindly legs, commonly found in swamps, marshes or the eponymous bogs. Bog Striders are attracted to their prey by ripples in the murky water, using their front legs as sensors for the vibrations. The Bog Strider aims to puncture its prey's body with its proboscis and injects acidic saliva that liquifies the innards, sucking out the resulting fluid. Due to their low intelligence and high dependency on pheromonal markings, they can be controlled with special pheromonal cocktails, making them ideal mounts for traversing wetlands.
054_bog_strider.name: Bog Strider

055_klabautermann.description: Klabautermänner are manifestations of a ships spirit, a result of a deep bond between a storied vessel and its crew. Mostly acting as an unseen force of good, when taking physical Klabautermänner love to manifest as a skeletal mariner, guiding their threatened vessel through a storm, repelling a boarding party or assisting in navigating treacherous waters. As a crew's bond and reputation grows, so does the Klabautermann's power - the mightiest of them being able to assert their control over weather and sea to prevent imminent disaster.
055_klabautermann.name: Klabautermann

056_sword_guardian.description: Not long after the invention of the trusty Shield Guardian demand  for a more attack-oriented counterpart spiked. This lead to the development of the Sword Guardian, a more nimble, albeit less hardy construct that excels at close quarter combat. Their combat tactics can be switched at a moment's notice, making them both capable bodyguards and assertive enforcers. While their stiff movements appear predictable, incautious opponents often find themselves blocked in by an unending barrage of precise Greatsword blows. Like their defensive brother-constructs, they are valuable assets for wizards in need of some artifical muscle or wealthy merchants looking for an effective deterrent.
056_sword_guardian.name: Sword Guardian

057_ridgeback_dunecrawler.description: Due to the spinal ougrowths on their upper shell, Ridgebacks can easily be mistaken for a cragged rock formation, especially when partially buried beneath the arid soil of their preferred habitat. They continually filter swathes of sand through gill-like structures, indiscriminately feeding on organic and non-organic matter, be it mineral deposits, plants, living creatures or dried out carcasses. A wandering or resting Ridgeback does not pose any particular danger, nomadic tribes are known to hitch a ride on a Dunecrawler's back to traverse the desert without the great beast paying them any mind. But their temper matches their size, and an angered Ridgeback resembles a force of nature, a walking mountain with titanic strength, shrouded in an ever-swirling tempest of sand.
057_ridgeback_dunecrawler.name: Ridgeback Dunecrawler

058_vrubel.description: Braying flocks of Vrubel cloud the multicoloured skies of the Abyss, their harrowing shrieks unnaturally reveberating through the twisted landscapes of madness. A gathering of Vrubel forms a choir, each of their voices intertwining into the abyssal dirge, a maddening song capable of twisting and breaking the minds of even the most stalwart individuals. The abyssal choirs act as demonic envoys, transmitting messages for higher demons to other planes of existence, carrying with them the innate chaos of the Abyss.
058_vrubel.name: Vrubel

059_gladiator_retiarius.description: Gladiators are grouped into different types, varying heavily in both fighting style and equipment. Certain types of Gladiator exclusively fight their respective counterpart, each fight resembling a deadly choreography studied to perfection. Retiarius and Murmillo exclusively duel each other, both of their skills honed to overcome the other. The Retiarius is a flink-footed and more lightly armoured fighter who nimbly evades their more heavily armoured opponent, only to artfully entangle them with their net and set up the perfect thrust from their trident.
059_gladiator_retiarius.name: Gladiator Retiarius

059_gladiator_murmillo.description: The brutish Murmillo however is recruited from the ranks of the most steadfast fighters, almost impossible to topple and capable of withstanding tremendous punishment. Both are evenly matched and capable of holding the audience's attention with their taunts and flourishes, their signature maneuvers and lethal finishers.
059_gladiator_murmillo.name: Gladiator Murmillo

059_gladiator_dimachaerus.description: The Dimachaerus is the diva of the arena, a master duelist who captivates the audience with artistic bladework and dizzying acrobatics. Fluidly switching between offensive and defensive fighting styles, the Dimachaerus prides themself on their ability to face any opponent, capable of outmaneuvering both the nimble Retiarius and outfighting the towering Murmillo. But a Dimachaerus balances on a knife's edge, any misstep in their complex choreography will be punished by their opponents - and the fickle audience, its favour as easily withdrawn as it is granted.
059_gladiator_dimachaerus.name: Gladiator Dimachaerus

060_crazed_reaper.description: Incessant screaming heralds the approach of the Crazed Reaper, a towering monstrosity filled with apoplectic madness and massive scythes for hands. It is to be assumed that these creatures did not came to be in a way even remotely considered natural and any means of reproduction short of mitosis by sheer force of anger seems unlikely. But until the source of their all-consuming madness is discovered, solitary Reapers will roam the lands, driven to murder anything that stands in their path, leaving a trail of severed limbs and burst ear drums in their wake, as well as more questions that could possibly be answered.
060_crazed_reaper.name: Crazed Reaper
